alert.note: Alert for De Kalb (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 6:04PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: .Several rounds of showers and thunderstorms have moved through the is area. In some locations over three inches of rain has fallen. The heavier rain has moved to the northeast. Additional showers and thunderstorms could bring another inch of rain...but for the most part the heavier rain should begin to recede. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following counties, De Kalb, Putnam, Smith and Wilson. * WHEN...Until 830 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 604 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Smithville, Watertown, Alexandria, Dowelltown, Liberty, Center Hill Lake and Edgar Evans State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
